results.title: Effects of atenolol on regional myocardial blood flow and ST segment elevation in the canine myocardium.
results.text_hl: ST segment elevation in @<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuropathy_Ischemic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018917 @@@ischaemic@@@ areas was significantly reduced. 3 Bilateral stellectomy induced similar effects to those of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

results.title: Chronic beta1-adrenoceptor blockade impairs ischaemic tolerance and preconditioning in murine myocardium.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Heart_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@Contractile dysfunction@@@ and elevated LDH were reduced >50% with IPC and SLP. While @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ treatment did not modify baseline contractile function, post-@<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuropathy_Ischemic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018917 @@@ischaemic@@@ function was significantly depressed compared to untreated hearts.

citations.NLM: See Hoe LE, Schilling JM, Busija AR, Haushalter KJ, Ozberk V, Keshwani MM, Roth DM, Toit ED, Headrick JP, Patel HH, Peart JN. Chronic beta1-adrenoceptor blockade impairs ischaemic tolerance and preconditioning in murine myocardium. Eur J Pharmacol. 2016 Oct 15;789():1-7. PMID: 27373851

results.title: Atenolol and ischaemic heart disease: an overview.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ appears to be effective as an anti-@<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuropathy_Ischemic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018917 @@@ischaemic@@@ agent in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with obstructive @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@ when reduction in myocardial @CHEMICAL_Oxygen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010100 @@@oxygen@@@ supply (@DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischaemia@@@ not preceded by an increase in heart rate and due presumably to functional @DISEASE_Coronary_Stenosis @DISEASE_MESH:D023921 @@@coronary stenosis@@@) or increase in demand are the likely causes.

citations.NLM: Cruickshank JM, McAinsh J. Atenolol and ischaemic heart disease: an overview. Curr Med Res Opin. 1991;12(8):485-96. PMID: 1764953
citations.BibTeX: @article{1764953, title={Atenolol and ischaemic heart disease: an overview.}, author={Cruickshank JM and McAinsh J}, journal={Curr Med Res Opin}, volume={12}, number={8}, pages={485-96}}

results.title: Effects of atenolol and diltiazem on exercise tolerance and ambulatory ischaemia.
results.text_hl: The difference between @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@ was mainly due to lower @<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuropathy_Ischemic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018917 @@@ischaemic@@@ activity with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ between 06:00 h and 12:00 h (P < 0.05).

results.title: Adrenoreceptors, endothelial function, and lipid profile: effects of atenolol, doxazosin, and carvedilol.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ increased the effort time (P < 0.05), total @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischaemia@@@ (P < 0.05), and the number of @<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuropathy_Ischemic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018917 @@@ischaemic@@@ episodes (P < 0.05).

results.title: [The effects of atenolol on the exercise symptoms of coronary patients. A double blind study (author's transl)].
results.text_hl: In an acute trial on the bicycle ergometer, the beta-receptor blocker @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in single morning doses of 50 mg produced a significant @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@reduction in blood pressure@@@, heart rate and @<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuropathy_Ischemic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018917 @@@ischaemic@@@ changes in the ECG.

citations.NLM: Bischoff K. [The effects of atenolol on the exercise symptoms of coronary patients. A double blind study (author's transl)]. MMW Munch Med Wochenschr. 1981 Sep 4;123(36):1337-40. PMID: 6792528

results.title: [Comparative anti-ischemic activity of atenolol and diltiazem. Crossed single-blind randomized study using a computerized exercise test].
results.text_hl: The results showed that exertion was improved to the same degree by the two drugs, but @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ had greater anti-@<m>DISEASE_Optic_Neuropathy_Ischemic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018917 @@@ischaemic@@@ activity than @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@.

citations.NLM: Berthout P, Bassand J, Schipman C, Faivre R, Mercier M, Cardot JC, Maurat JP. [Comparative anti-ischemic activity of atenolol and diltiazem. Crossed single-blind randomized study using a computerized exercise test]. Rev Med Interne. 1985 Jun;6(3):259-65. PMID: 3901170
